body:
(I am bad at photo editing, but it works)



I am proud to present the footage from the scrim we had last night, The Game Changes VS Team Allah. I really enjoyed editing this and playing it to, and I look forward to future ones. Thanks to Pizza and Robo for organizing it,  and thanks to everybody who turned up. There was a lot of footage to edit, so if you want you could leave a like or maybe subscribe :)

Video: http://youtu.be/H5Z5lavnyo4

(Video may be bad quality or not play for about 2 hours after uploading)

replies.body:
He doesn't need permission. Yes its nice if he asks the other team but he can upload it if he wants to. I don't see how it can be considered harrasment. He didn't insult you, talk trash about you or anything like that, its just a video between two teams. I honestly see that as a horrible reason and I wouldn't delete the video if I was in his place.

It also looks like it was on Overcast's practice servers and event coordinators on Overcast posted that you are allowed to post scrimmages at any time. Even if its between Avicus teams it was played on Overcasts servers so those rules apply.

replies.body:
Juano and Notal, this video is not "harassment" in any way whatsoever. If your team did poorly, it does not mean that legoche is not allowed to upload it. Although it would have been a better idea to ask for permission to upload, he does not need your teams' consent whatsoever. If your team lost, you lost. It's a game, and just because he uploads the video does not mean that we will think any less of you, if that is what you are worried about. I think that the term "harassment" is extremely exaggerated, and is unnecessary. Let's not start a flame war.

legoche, great video! Thumbs up from me! :D

I think that the term "harassment" is extremely exaggerated, and is unnecessary. Let's not start a flame war.

replies.body:
I'm down for the rematch as long as I can make it. Twas all banter m8 and I'm still chill with you. You've been a good role model for your team, as not to insult, but I feel that some team members were kind of salty about the loss and I'm glad to see you're keeping a clear head. 

I don't want or need a flame war, so any hate replies I will ignore. 

Good day and gl with the re-match, hopefully we will both have full squads.

replies.body:
You guys did ok, but so many things wrong. I'm going to be brutally honest here. Here's some feedback for ya.
1) The frontside, backside, and none of the areas of the ship were not watered aside from the 2 antennas. Also the diamonds were not watered.
2) NONE of the chests were watered, neither did you save diamonds.
3) You guys REALLY need to learn how to cannon and not build potatoes.  
4) You guys need to start a skybridge and have someone shot-calling for underbridges and such. 
5) You have to learn basic tourney shit. This includes how to properly water objectives including cores and antennas. 
I could go on much more, but in all honesty any half-decent OCN team would have absolutely demolished you. You guys have alot to learn.
*Edit: Before you flip shit lashing at me for mentioning OCN, literally you guys don't play badly but you just need to learn basic stuff. Then you'll be much better.

replies.body: Well you cannot expect them to be good at a game they don't regularly play. We are Avicus, not Overcast. They were playing on OCN maps with the OCN plugin, a completely different gameplay of Nebula. In my first scrim, I didn't know how to play and I have done my best to learn from that. Once we have actual scrim servers, lets see how OCN team vs OCN team goes on an Avicus server. You know what's gonna happen? We going to see them playing at a lower performance as well. This is normal and you cannot expect people to be good at something they don't practice.

replies.body:
If you didn't know I'm on proximity FYI, an AVICUS team.
Being able to strategise maps swiftly is part of a skill. 90% of Proximity was unfamiliar with RFV2 strats until Micheal managed to come up with some stuff after 2 minutes. If you can't do that you have alot to learn. Also considering team allah is like 50% OCN, it's not a fair advantage for them. 
Also DTMs and CTWs are MUCH more simpler compared to DTCs, if you didn't know. No cannoning and TNT involved, etc.
replies.body_tagged:
If you didn't know I'm on proximity FYI, an AVICUS team.
Being able to strategise maps swiftly is part of a skill. 90% of Proximity was unfamiliar with RFV2 strats until Micheal managed to come up with some stuff after 2 minutes. If you can't do that you have alot to learn. Also considering team allah is like 50% OCN, it's not a fair advantage for them. 
Also DTMs and CTWs are MUCH more simpler compared to DTCs, if you didn't know. No cannoning and TNT involved, etc.

reply_to.body: Well you cannot expect them to be good at a game they don't regularly play. We are Avicus, not Overcast. They were playing on OCN maps with the OCN plugin, a completely different gameplay of Nebula. In my first scrim, I didn't know how to play and I have done my best to learn from that. Once we have actual scrim servers, lets see how OCN team vs OCN team goes on an Avicus server. You know what's gonna happen? We going to see them playing at a lower performance as well. This is normal and you cannot expect people to be good at something they don't practice.

reply_to.body:
You guys did ok, but so many things wrong. I'm going to be brutally honest here. Here's some feedback for ya.
1) The frontside, backside, and none of the areas of the ship were not watered aside from the 2 antennas. Also the diamonds were not watered.
2) NONE of the chests were watered, neither did you save diamonds.
3) You guys REALLY need to learn how to cannon and not build potatoes.  
4) You guys need to start a skybridge and have someone shot-calling for underbridges and such. 
5) You have to learn basic tourney shit. This includes how to properly water objectives including cores and antennas. 
I could go on much more, but in all honesty any half-decent OCN team would have absolutely demolished you. You guys have alot to learn.
*Edit: Before you flip shit lashing at me for mentioning OCN, literally you guys don't play badly but you just need to learn basic stuff. Then you'll be much better.

2) NONE of the chests were watered, neither did you save diamonds.
3) You guys REALLY need to learn how to cannon and not build potatoes.  
4) You guys need to start a skybridge and have someone shot-calling for underbridges and such. 
5) You have to learn basic tourney shit. This includes how to properly water objectives including cores and antennas. 
I could go on much more, but in all honesty any half-decent OCN team would have absolutely demolished you. You guys have alot to learn.
*Edit: Before you flip shit lashing at me for mentioning OCN, literally you guys don't play badly but you just need to learn basic stuff. Then you'll be much better.

replies.body:
Are you trying to make me sound like an idiot? How would I know you are in Proximity? The roster is secret. Plus, I know that most of the players on Proximity have had scrim experience so I don't believe you. I'm just trying to say that the way you worded that obviously is bad-mouthing both clans in this game. If it's just me, maybe you wouldn't believe me but, as you can see, part of the community is on my side. 

And by the way, I do know DTC is more complex but, "if you didn't know" there are quite a few DTM maps with TnT such as Cherryland, Berryland, and other various maps.

Whoa, guys chill out. Just because a couple of players are giving your contructive critism doesn't mean you lashout on them. It's their opinion, and I dislike you dissing directly at them.

@pokerface:
" If it's just me, maybe you wouldn't believe me but, as you can see, part of the community is on my side. "
That's one huge assumption, I would be careful.

Locking, since I stated everything I needed to say and to be frank with all of you, I dislike seeing misconceptions everywhere on threads.
